questions.question: What is the main goal of using Support Vector Machine (SVM) in credit card fraud detection?

answers.a: To reduce the number of credit card transactions

explanations.a: The goal is not to limit transactions but to detect fraud within them.
explanations.b: Correct! SVM is used to classify and detect fraudulent vs. legitimate transactions.
explanations.c: SVM focuses on classification accuracy, not transaction processing speed.
explanations.d: Encryption is a security function, not related to SVM or classification.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a commonly used kernel in SVM?

explanations.a: Commonly used when data is linearly separable.
explanations.b: Used to model complex, non-linear relationships.
explanations.c: Very popular for non-linear classification tasks.
explanations.d: Correct!Rarely used in practice due to unstable performance in many cases.

questions.question: Why is SVM effective in handling credit card fraud detection problems?

answers.c: It performs well with high-dimensional and imbalanced data

explanations.a: Preprocessing like normalization is essential for SVM performance.
explanations.b: Class balancing techniques must be applied manually.
explanations.c: Correct!It performs well with high-dimensional and imbalanced data
explanations.d: No model guarantees 100% accuracy in real-world scenarios.

questions.question: What is the role of kernel functions in SVM?

answers.a: To convert numeric data into categorical
answers.c: To map data into a higher-dimensional space for better separability
answers.d: To remove outliers from the data

explanations.a: Data type conversion is unrelated to kernels.
explanations.b: Precision and recall are performance metrics, not roles of kernel functions.
explanations.c: Correct!To map data into a higher-dimensional space for better separability
explanations.d: Kernel functions do not remove outliers; that requires other preprocessing techniques.
